page.title: 10The Dock (cont.)
page.content: At the present time the politics of this matter is still being debated in Parliament as Ipswich and Harwich docks, the other Haven Ports, feel threatened by furher growth of Felixstowe Dock. If it is built, the extension will be called the Trinity Terminal after Trinity College who used to own the land. It takes 15hr to unload and reload each ship at Felixstowe, one container being loaded or unloaded every 3min. It is going to cost 8 million pounds to dredge the harbour so that it is deeper for the bigger ships. The Passenger services started in 1974 and there are frequent car ferries to the Continent, particularly Zeebrugge in Belgium. Day trips to Belgian and French hypermar- kets are inexpensive encourage tour- ism in Felixstowe.
